item.title: Chainsaw Man Director is Working on a New Horror Game for Roblox
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/chainsaw-man-director-is-working-on-a-new-horror-game-for-roblox/

The director of Chainsaw Man is working on a new roguelite horror game on Roblox called The Inn. 

Spotted by Gameranx, The Inn’s official X account (formerly Twitter) revealed the upcoming Roblox game with a new trailer recently, informing players that Ryu Nakayama, the director of Chainsaw Man, is directing the title. Nakayama is known for his work on projects like Jujutsu Kaisen, Yatterman Night, and more. Nakayama hasn’t worked on a game before The Inn. 

The Inn’s trailer starts with the players stepping into a traditional Japanese inn, which seems inviting from the outside but dreadful from the inside. We see some rooms engulfed in flames, supernatural beings popping up in jump scares, blood splattered everywhere, and other horror elements. No release date or window was provided for the game.

On the Chainsaw Man Director’s personal X account, Nakayama revealed that he is working on the Roblox Horror Game in collaboration with Mayflower. It is his “first time working on a game” and has been a “challenging and exciting” experience. The director added that even though he knows that Roblox is a popular platform in North America,  he is “deliberately trying to give it a stronger Japanese feel” (as translated by Google on X). 

In other news, Lies of P publisher’s Brown Dust 2 is going viral for all the wrong reasons. Also, Nintendo Switch 2 pre-order invites begin rolling out from next month. item.title: ‘Breath of The Wild’ And Its DLC is $90 on Nintendo Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/breath-of-the-wild-and-its-dlc-is-90-on-nintendo-switch-2/

Nintendo’s Legend of Zelda: Breath of the wild and its DLC will set players back $90 for its Nintendo Switch 2 version.

That’s according to the mathmagician wizard out there (not really), who have calculated that whichever way you try to get the game and its DLC on the Nintendo Switch 2, it’s going to be $90.

That’s because Nintendo are notoriously bad for not discounting its games, no matter how old they are.

$90, Quick Maths

I first spotted these amazing calculations by Paul Tassi at Forbes, but basically, $90 is the number you get to no matter how you try and play the game on the Nintendo Switch 2.

For those looking to buy the game outright, it will set you back $70, plus the $20 DLC taking you to $90. For those looking to upgrade from the original Nintendo Switch version, you’ll still have to buy the game for $60 and need to buy the “enhanced” edition for an additional $10. Add on the $20 for the DLC and you’re at the $90 price point once again.

The news likely adds even more frustration to what has been a disastrous reveal for the Nintendo Switch 2. It’s $450 console price point (which could still increase in the US following all the tariff shenanigans) has been a constant cause for debate in the community.

RELATED – Nintendo Switch 2 Games Will Cost Up To $98 For Physical Games When Converted From Euros

Admittingly, though, it’s a console that’s still going to fly off the shelves, but I’m personally finding Nintendo’s greed here a little hard to stomach, especially given the current economic climate. It seems like whichever way we look at it, more expensive games are going to be hitting us sooner rather than later.
